summary: In FY 2022, federal agencies made an estimated $247 billion in payment errors—payments that either should not have been made or that were made in the incorrect amount. But some agencies have made progress reducing the number of such errors in their programs. This report—the second in a series of quarterly reports—examines how these agencies worked to reduce payment errors. Some agencies improved the accountability...
title: Improper Payments: Programs Reporting Reductions Had Taken Corrective Actions That Shared Common Features
